result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Matthew Wanta

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kyle Matthew Wanta
Current: 1220 Towline Rd, Apt. 8, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 1220 Towline Rd, Wausau, WI 54403 United States

Defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta in court.  Called 3:08 PM. FTR recorded. Called 15CF55 & 15CM06. Court - questions defendant in regards to current employment status, defendant owes $1717 total in both cases. Defendant asks for payment plan, suggests $50/ month. Court advises due to amount owed would need to be more, defendant then asks for $100/month. Court imposes monthly payment of $100, commencing 1/2/16. Clerk to send all paperwork in the mail.

Defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:22 PM. Also called 15TR228 and 15TR11, 15CM06, 15CF55. State - resolved - 15CM06 - plead to count #1 as alleged, $300 fine plus costs and surcharges, all other counts DRI, 15CF53 - DRI #1, #4, #5 and #6, plead to counts #2 and #3 as alleged - court costs one each count, probation for 2 years with conditions of AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety with no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry, employment/school, 150 hours of community service; 15CF55 - amend #3 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a), plead to count #1 as alleged - court costs, #3 - 60 days in FC jail and court costs - consecutive to any other sentence currently imposed and or being served, #2, #4 and #5 to be DRI, dismiss 15TR228 and 15TR11. Scholke and Wanta agree. Court amends count #3 on 15CF55 to misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a), Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3 and #4 on 15CM06, dismisses and reads in #1, #4, #5 and #6 on 15CF53, court dismisses 15TR228 and 15TR11, court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #4 and #5 on 15CF55. Wanta pleads NC to count #1 on 15CM06, pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 on on 15CF53, pleads NC to counts count #1 as alleged and #3 as amended on 15CF55. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntary and intelligently waives his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right ot JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - will be starting jail sentence in Marathon County case on 10/5/15 and asks court to allow this sentence to be served in Marathon County as well. Wanta makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CM06 - count #1 - $300 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO; counts #2 and #3 on 15CF53 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: follow all rules placed on defendant by P&P, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments that sell alcohol including beer tents, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service, costs on each count - paid thru probation; count #1 on 15CF55 - court costs, count #3 - court costs, 60 days in FC jail - consecutive to Marathon County Case that he will begin serving on 10/5/15 - no objections to serving the sentence in Marathon County but ultimate decision of the sheriff(s) - report on 10/5/15 by 8:00 PM - huber and good time allowed - credit for 3 days credit on 15CM06 on jail time, 2 days on 15CF53 and 1 day on 15CF55, submit DNA sample, right to appeal.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle Matthew Wanta
Current: 1220 Towline Rd, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 144 State Highway 49, Wittenberg, WI 54499

Defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 10:03 AM. Also called 15TR228, 15CF55, 15TR11, 15CM06. State - here for several PH's - believes they will be waived. Scholke agrees, has all complaints, waives reading for all of the complaints and will proceed with waiver of PH. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights to PH on both cases, binds over for trial on both CF cases. Scholke has Informations for both cases, waives reading of them, will proceed to ARGN, enters NG pleas to all counts and set all matters for another FPT. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on all cases and sets all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:21 AM. Also called 15CF55, 15TR11, 15TR228 and 15CF53. Roley would like to address the Court regarding representing the defendant on all the matters - asking for adjournment of all cases to see if another SPD appointment will be made for the defendant otherwise asking Court to appoint Roley at county expense and relieve SPD of their obligations. State responds and would like to proceed today for stated reasons (officers ready to testify). Clerk informed parties of message of JA regarding SPD appoint. Roley responds. Court responds - asking Roley if he will take the case if SPD appoints him today. Roley responds - not on SPD list anymore so can't be appointed to any more cases thru SPD. Wanta wants legal counsel to represent him in all matters per collaquey by Court. Wanta is willing to waive time lines for all PH's. Recess at 10:31 AM to call SPD. Back on record at 10:35 AM with same appearances. Court will continue all matters as previosuly scheduled for 7/21/15 at 10:00 AM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta in court with attorney Thomas Clinton Roley.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:57 AM, also called 15TR11, 15TR228, 15CF53 and 15-6140. State - here for INIT on 15CM06 and 15CF53 and intake on traffic matter. Roley has complaints and waives reading of all of them, enters NG pleas to CM cases and TR cases, and on CF case - requests PH and will waive time limits for PH. Wanta agrees. Court accepts pleas on CM matter, set 15CM06 for FPT on 6/2/15, set 15CF53 for PH on 6/2/15 and set both traffic matters for STC on 6/2/15, continues bond on all matters.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle Matthew Wanta not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:21 AM. State - S&C were mailed and not returned. State - move to 2/25/15 at 9:00 AM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
